dead_loner_J1: This isn't what I expected from the afterlife.
dead_loner_J2: This isn't what I expected from the afterlife.
sc_ur_loner_Ren1: Oh- I haven't seen you before. Did you get lost?
[You finally glance around at your surroundings. Ah, yes, you definitely have gotten yourself lost.]
[You look at t_c. {PRONOUN/t_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/t_c/seem/seems} like {PRONOUN/t_c/subject} {VERB/t_c/know/knows} the area better than you.]
[You ask for {PRONOUN/t_c/poss} help home and t_c happily points you in the right direction.]
sc_ur_loner_c: What's your name? y_c? Oh, what a pretty name.
What do you think my name would be if I were a Clan cat?
live_df_ps_1: How curious... a creature, roaming these rooted confinements.
Do not be afraid, your fear will not aid you. I had to learn that the hard way, alone.
live_df_ps_2: It seems you are lost in more ways than one.
As am I, I suppose we have that much in common. Lucky you.
live_df_ps_3: You can run as much as you'd like.
In time, the trees will start to whisper misguidance to you.
Then, you will never find your way home.
live_df_ps_4: I've seen wondrous lands, even whilst alone and afraid.
It makes me bitter, you know. Knowing all that is out there...
Yet, the place I was supposed to call home is the same that drags me here.
live_df_ps_5: You can't trust anyone, I learnt that out there.
dead_outsider_J7: How awful must I have been, to end up in the hell for a belief that I didn't even hold?
Guess I'd better start learning some of this 'Clan' stuff. Hey, wanna teach me?
living_ur_kit_Guy1: Do you have a family, little one?
Oh... you're one of them. I'm glad you have someone to look out for you.
living_ur_loner_Guy1: Are you happy in a Clan?
I can't imagine having all of those cats constantly around... especially now that I'm a ghost.
[You feel like the loner is moreso assuring {PRONOUN/t_c/self} rather than of you.]
you_df_they_ur_CM1: [You turn around, your fur bristling along your spine. Only to see a nearly transparent, misty cat. t_c.]
All my life, I never much cared for the ways of the 'Clans'. Too violent.
But I never thought your afterlife would be like this.
[You take a deep breath, explaining to t_c that not all Clan cats go... here.]
Well, maybe I should be glad that you are here, then.
you_df_they_ur_CM2: [Running through the cold shadows that coat the Rotwound, you stumble back just in time to not run directly into what, at first, seems to be a cloud of mist. Then you realize that it's a cat, but not one from StarClan. Too wispy.]
You poor thing... ending up in a place like this. Here, let me.
[t_c crouches down, giving gentle laps at the thick layers of shadowy rot that has been matted to your fur since you arrived.]
[You squeal, trying to squirm away from the misty-coated cat's surprise bathtime. When you manage to escape and bolt off, you do somehow seem cleaner. Huh.]
ur_ur_loner_Guy1: ... yeah, me too. I used to wonder what would happen after death. It's boring!
